page.title: 02The Sands Centre Carlisle(i)
page.content: The Sands sports and leisure Centre was opened by Labour Party leader Neil Kinnock in April 1985. Local Conserv- ative councillors threatened to boycott the ceremony because they felt a non-political personality such as Daley Thompson should have been invited. Though the Centre cost City rate- payers Â£4 million to build, nearly all would agree that it provides much needed (and used) facilities, and a venue worthy of nationally known entertainers, such as singer Barbara Dickson, comedian Lenny Henry, and the Scottish National Orchestra. The larger hall can accommodate up to 1500 on tiered seating which slides away to provide 10,700 square feet of games space.Tickets _ printed by computer with your name on _ cost between Â£3.50 and Â£4.50 for the Lenny Henry Show.
